Dose Configuration Class

Source: R/DoseConfigurator.R
DoseConfiguration-class.Rd

Initialize a new DoseConfiguration object

Check if the current configuration satisfies monotonicity constraints

Update the current configuration

Get the number of dose levels in the configuration

Get indices of acceptable doses (those with value 1)

Get indices of unacceptable doses (those with value 0)

Generate a string representation of the configuration

Print the dose configuration

Arguments

drugCombiObject

An object of class DrugCombination

isNonDecreasing

Logical indicating monotonicity direction (TRUE for non-decreasing)

currentConfig

Optional numeric vector representing the initial configuration

newConfig

Numeric vector representing the new configuration

Value

Logical indicating whether the configuration is valid

Numeric value representing the number of dose levels

Numeric vector of indices for acceptable doses

Numeric vector of indices for unacceptable doses

Character string representing the configuration

Details

A reference class that represents and manages dose configurations for dose-finding studies. This class handles the binary representation of dose combinations, where each configuration indicates whether a dose combination is acceptable (1) or unacceptable (0) based on toxicity. It ensures that dose configurations satisfy monotonicity constraints.

Fields

drugCombi

An object of class DrugCombination-class

currentConfig

A numeric vector representing the current configuration of dose levels (1 for acceptable doses, 0 for unacceptable doses)

isNonDecreasing

Logical indicating whether the configuration follows a non-decreasing pattern (TRUE) or non-increasing pattern (FALSE)

isValid

Logical indicating whether the current configuration satisfies monotonicity constraints

See also

PipeEstimator-class for the class that uses dose configurations to implement the PIPE methodology, DrugCombination-class for the underlying drug combination class
